body.name: Perixx PERIMICE-713 Wireless Ergonomic Vertical Mouse - 800/1200/1600 DPI - Right Handed - Recommended with RSI User
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 2 hrs 16 mins
features: ERGO MOUSE - Natural ergonomic vertical mouse designed for right-handed that promotes natural hand posture while using the mouse for long-lasting comfort; 6-button mouse to increase your productivity
3 DPI LEVELS - Optical sensor for accurate navigation; Mouse sensitivity can be changed with the DPI control button; Adjustable 3 DPI levels of the 800/ 1200 (default)/ 1600
WIRELESS FREEDOM - Wireless 2.4GHz ergonomic vertical mouse provides up to 10 meters operation range; Nano USB receiver with storage compartment, easy for you to store your USB
POWER-SAVING - Built in power ON/OFF switch button and power saving function. Two AAA batteries needed (batteries are not included in the package)
CERTIFIED QUALITY - FCC, CE, RoHS qualified ergonomic mouse; Compatible with Windows 7, 8, 10, 11, and later versions. Package includes: 1 wireless mouse, 1 USB receiver, 1 user manual

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Ergonomic Design Vertical mouse promotes natural hand posture while using the mouse for long-lasting comfort. Natural Position The handshake position reduces the wrist and forearm from bending unnaturally. Wireless Connectivity The 2.4 GHz is reliable and provides a lag-free wireless connection. Easy plug-and-play setup. Next page 1 Ergonomic Design 2 Natural Position 3 Wireless Connectivity

Previous page Soft-Touch Coating Streamlined design with a rubber coating that is comfortable to hold and does not get dirty easily. Power-Saving PERIMICE-713 will go into sleep mode if no movement is detected after 6 minutes. 3 DPI Levels Mouse sensitivity can be changed with the DPI control button on the fly (800/1200 (default)/1600). Next page 1 Soft-Touch Coating 2 Power-Saving 3 3 DPI Levels
Measure Your Hand Size PERIMICE-713 is a great fit for users with medium to large hands.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good ergonomic mouse, especially for your first one!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this mouse to give my arms a rest. Opening it up it doesn't feel cheap even though it is a third of the price of the ergonomic mice at Big Box. It has the soft plastic on it. As soon as I started using it I felt a sense of relief in my forearm. Set up on Windows 10 was effortless, rhe drivers were automatically installed.I've included a photo to try to show the size of the mouse. I'm a woman and my hand is about 8 in long.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE LOVE LOVE
reviews.reviewText: I cannot believe how comfortable this mouse is. I just smile when I sit down to use it. With tendinitis, I wanted to care well for my arms while increasing my computer time and this was the ticket! Couldn't be happier with the ease of use and comfort.⭐️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Takes a little time getting used to...
reviews.reviewText: The mouse is heavier than others. So either adjust your cursor speed on your computer, or just take the time to get used to the weight. I am clicking like crazy 8 hours daily and so far so good. At first I was missing where to click as it was a little difficult to aim, but once I adjusted the cursor speed to my liking, and held the mouse by the very peak at first to get used to the weight, it all panned out. Been using it for a week and so far so good. Better quality than some others out there. Really sturdy, and looks cool. I got a wired as I didn't want to mess around with batteries all the time. So no delays and quite responsive. I haven't used any of the extra side buttons yet. So sure what I could use them for, to be frank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice design, but too small. Medium/Large version isn't
reviews.reviewText: I bought the 513 hoping to replace my old beat-up Evoluent VM4. Unfortunately, the 513 is very small, narrow and virtually unusable. I could feel my thumb cramping from having to tuck in so much to get a grip on the mouse. It *is* pretty and well built, but the 513 was a better fit for my 5'4 wife than me at 6'3 and with relatively large hands. I can get into a relatively comfortable position with the right grip, but only with my two smallest fingers dragging on the desk. It doesn't have enough height or the right angle for a natural position of a large hand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT WIRELESS MOUSE

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Game Changer!
reviews.reviewText: I wish I had this mouse YEARS ago. It fits perfectly into my hand, truly as it supposed to do, holding it is like shaking a hand. After years and years of using a small mouse, this is so much better. It's taller of course, shaped almost like a shark's fin, so I'm still negotiating around it, trying not to knock it over lol. Only negative is that for me to use it with Macbook Air it does require batteries, not rechargeable. But it is Bluetooth and wifi connectable. I love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Too vertical, still causes pain, just in a different spot
reviews.reviewText: Update 2022-04-09:This mouse has caused immense pain in my thumb and wrist. I have dropped the rating to 1 star (previously was 3 stars). I stopped using it and went back to a "regular" mouse and my wrist and thumb pain went away almost completely in less than 3 days. However, now my previous pain is coming back from using the regular mouse.Original review:This mouse is too close to vertical to really be comfortable. I think it needs to be closer 45 degrees to really alleviate the pain completely. I've been using this thing for a few weeks now, and the pain that I was feeling before has subsided, but now I have pain in a different area above my index finger. This is because the angle is too steep and it causes me to strain a different muscle in my arm.It's taking a long time to get used to this vertical layout, which makes it much more difficult to be precise with movements. The mouse overall is quite tall, and I find myself bumping it very often when moving my hand from the keyboard to try to put it on to the mouse.The DPI button is nice to have, but is in a very awkward spot and is hard to hit. I'm not able to make changes on the fly like I was expecting and like my old mouse was able to do, because the button is too awkward to press. Also the DPI change is not substantial enough to really even be worth doing it.Lastly, there's a very strange issue ever since I plugged in this mouse. Periodically the mouse cursor will jump all the way across the screen to some random position. I Frequently have to reposition the mouse back to where I needed it to be. This is very frustrating especially when working with images, because when I click to draw something the mouse cursor is not where I expected it to be. I've never seen this happen with any other mouse that I've used, and it started immediately after I started using this mouse.For the most part this thing works as advertised (minus the weird jumping around issue), and it did alleviate the pain I was having before, but it's really not a solution to wrist pain in general. The main buttons work, the scroll wheel works, the back and forward buttons work, and the DPI buttons work. Build quality seems fine. I like that there's no battery to have to worry about, but overall I'm not really satisfied with this purchase. I'm not sure yet if I'll return it, or just cycle it back and forth with my other regular mouse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable Design, Short Lifespan
reviews.reviewText: The Perixx PERIMICE-713 initially impressed me with its great ergonomic design, which provided a comfortable grip for right-handed users. However, my overall experience with this mouse has been marred by its longevity.Regrettably, after just a year of use, the mouse ceased to function properly, leaving me disappointed with the quality. While the design and features are commendable, the lifespan of the product did not meet my expectations.
As an accountant who needs to use my mouse nonstop for hours, I need a vertical mouse & appreciate this one can help. Just ordered one more.
La verdad me parece excelente, bueno, bonito y barato. Hasta el momento funciona muy bien, sin ningún problema. Es muy cómodo, evita que un hueso de mi muñeca se hinche. Altamente recomendable
bonne efficacité, fonctionne à merveille pour un travail de bureau récurent....

This is a great product, however, it is recommended that one use a mouse pad with a cushion to avoid too much strain on arms. It is advisable that you switch between normal mouse and this mouse once a week so your hands do not develop swelling after a prolong use

Tiene un tacto muy agradable y funciona correctamente. Se ha conectado él sólo a la primera, ha sido muy sencillo, el pc lo ha detectado enseguida. Se le oye mucho el clic, eso sí.Edito: a los dos meses me ha dejado de funcionar bien, he mirado bastante y no sé qué puede ser.
